programmes.show_description: (2020) Groundhog day shoot 'em up with Frank Grillo, Naomi Watts and Mel Gibson. Ray gets killed every day. Can he escape by unravelling the mystery of why a bunch of people want him dead?
(2019) Sci-fi drama starring Eva Green as an astronaut who gets the mission she's always dreamed of, but faces a tug-of-love between her personal and professional life.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(1965) William Whitney's brutal western. Two former Confederate rebels are offered their freedom if they can track, catch or even kill their former gang mates. Starring Audie Murphy.
(1945) Riveting film noir melodrama starring Oscar-nominated Gene Tierney as an irredeemably evil, possessive woman who resorts to murder to keep her husband (Cornel Wilde) with her.
(1958) Swashbuckling adventure starring June Laverick. Robin Hood is dead and his band of followers seek a worthy new leader. And they get one who exceeds all their expectations.
(1960) Fantasy adventure. Claude Rains plays a scientist who, convinced that dinosaurs still roam the earth, sets off into the Amazon to find them. Based on Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's novel.
(2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum and Liam Hemsworth. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.
Director Quentin Tarantino and stars Samuel L Jackson, Christoph Waltz, Jamie Foxx and Kerry Washington talk about making the western adventure set against a backdrop of slavery.
(2012) Quentin Tarantino's darkly comic, award-laden western with Jamie Foxx, Christopher Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio and Samuel L Jackson. A freed slave searches for his wife... and revenge.
(2020) Dark Adam Brody comedy. Abe was a childhood detecting prodigy but is now a failing PI. But when a local boy is killed Abe gets the case. Things are looking up (for Abe, not the boy).
(1971) Crime thriller starring Richard Crenna. A recently paroled thief must do one last job to pay off old debts. But can he get away with it and build a life with his new girlfriend?
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(1970) Multi-Oscar-winning, fact-based, Second World War drama starring George C Scott, who gives a vivid portrait of the famously straight-talking US commander General George Patton.
(1959) Western. Randolph Scott plays a bounty hunter who has unfinished business with the brother of his latest target. But his quest for revenge looks like it could be undermined.
Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.
(1949) World War II drama starring Gregory Peck as a US general who must treat a demoralised bomber squadron severely to restore discipline. With Oscar-winning support from Dean Jagger.
(1993) Comedy starring Robin Williams and Sally Field. A struggling actor dresses as a woman to get his estranged wife to hire him as a housekeeper, so he can spend more time with his kids.
(2023) Sci-fi extravaganza starring John David Washington. An undercover operative must destroy a superweapon in a war against AI. But the superweapon looks like a little girl.
